attributes.action: Continue the Rail Electrification Works between Cardiff and London via Bristol
attributes.background:
On 8th November, it has been reported that electrification works on the railways between Cardiff and London via Bristol, among other works, will be arbitrarily and indefinitely delayed from the previous schedule.

This is an insult to the people of Bristol, Wales and the South West.
attributes.additional_details:
"Costly and disruptive electrification works" have already been underway in Bristol and the Severn Tunnel. To delay capitalizing on the progress that has already been made is to ask the region to absorb the economic penalties from those works without view of payback in improved service.

We urge the minister Paul Maynard to honour his party's manifesto pledge, reconsider this decision and continue with the works as planned.

https://goo.gl/IpVbRY

https://goo.gl/osNOoe

attributes.action: A 2nd EU Referendum to be held with Compulsory Voting for the Eligible.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to Conduct a 2nd Referendum with Compulsory voting  for all who are eligible, with an abstention option on the ballot paper. This will give a true majority of the UK voters wishes regarding the EU and a true mandate to Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The British Election Study asked a question on whether people regretted how they voted or not. Only 1% of people who voted Remain said they regretted their vote, but 6% of people who voted Leave said they regretted their vote.

attributes.action: Restrict all heavy lorries with speed limiters to one lane on motorways.
attributes.background: As heavy vehicles are fitted with speed limiters, overtaking can take several miles and cause congestion and tailback to vehicles without speed restrictors.
attributes.additional_details: The effect is to cause congestion and tailbacks to other motorway users.

attributes.action: Minimum 3 month driving ban and £1k fine if caught using a mobile phone driving.
attributes.background: Using a hand held mobile phone while driving can have the same consequences as drink driving. Drivers caught not using hands free devices should be subject to a minimum 3 month driving ban and a minimum £1000 fine. The only way we can try and stop this is by imposing tougher laws.

attributes.action: Abolish the tv licence, it shouldn't be a legal requirement.
attributes.background: I believe the TV licence should be abolished, removed and not a legal requirement. It should be included through your provider for free. Tv is expensive enough without the added extra worry of £130+ A year.

attributes.action: i would like to propose one day a year where all commercial flights are banned.
attributes.background: Reports have been released showing the extent that the flight ban after 9/11 had on climate change. These reports show promising figures of an overall drop of average temperature. I believe that by banning non necessary and commercial flights for one day a year could help to slow down global warming
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.greenmedinfo.com/blog/artificial-weather-revealed-post-9-11-flight-groundings 
http://globalnews.ca/news/2934513/empty-skies-after-911-set-the-stage-for-an-unlikely-climate-change-experiment/
i have supplied two sources which both support my claim however many more are available with a simple google search.

attributes.action: Stop putting the clocks forward for British Summertime (BST) leave UK on GMT
attributes.background: The clocks changing for British Summertime started 100 years ago. The UK did this when Germany started doing it, apparently it was to save coal. Farmers have lights on their tractors and lights in their cattle sheds so this only serves to cause a nuisance for most of us. Especially those with kids

attributes.action: Amend the1967 abortion act.No abortion after 24 weeks. Equality for all.
attributes.background:
In the UK it is legal to terminate a pregnancy up untill birth if the child has a disability such as Downs Syndrome. However it is illegal to terminate a child without a disability after 24 weeks.Help me to outlaw disability based abortions.No abortion after 24 weeks. 
#tellitrightstartitright
attributes.additional_details:
Lord Shinkwin’s Bill wants to outlaw abortions on the grounds of disability
If successful, the Abortion (Disability Equality) Bill will remove section 1(1)(d) from the 1967 Abortion Act, which allows for abortion on the grounds of disability up-to-birth. In the UK, disability-selective abortions are currently available right up to the moment of birth whereas in most cases, “healthy” babies cannot be aborted beyond 24 weeks.
#equalityforall
#tellitrightstartitright 
#SaveourDownsydromecommunity

attributes.action: Pass a law so that EU roaming charges are abolished despite the Brexit vote
attributes.background: The EU has introduce a law to ban roaming charges across the union. However, as UK is leaving those laws won't apply for UK networks and charges will go up. One way is to make a law to stop networks charging for EU roaming. This law could be reciprocal to make negotiations easier.
attributes.additional_details: This law will work by making mobile networks abolish roaming charges or face fines if they fail to do so. This will protect holidaymakers from shock bills. You could also introduce a reciprocal law for EU holidaymakers coming to the UK. This means that EU mobile networks can't charge for roaming in he UK. This will make negotiations easier as it will benefit EU citizens as well.

attributes.action: Stop premium rate mobile phone service subscriptions without confirmatory text
attributes.background: Many mobile phone users have found themselves subscribed to premium rate services which are charged to their phone bills simply because they closed an unwanted pop up advert while browsing the internet. There is no cooling off period, and usually no confirmation text so bill payer is not aware!
attributes.additional_details: To stop the charges being levied unfairly there should be a 14 day cooling off period before any service charges, secondly, as many of these services don't send a confirmation text that a subscription has been set up the mobile phone user may not know. The law must be changed to stop these unfair subscriptions and charges.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Oxfordshire's membership of the European Union
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU Referendum Oxfordshire voted to stay in the EU 70% to 30% but now risk being dragged out of the EU like Scotland and having a vote on the membership is in no way subverting democracy
attributes.additional_details: Oxford is a city who's economy is reliant on the EU and dragging them out would be completely undemocratic

attributes.action: Stop the UK selling arms to any side of the Syrian conflict
attributes.background: The only way of ending the conflict in Syria is to stop supplying sides with arms. The UK government has a responsibility to ensure that any involvement in conflicts do not harm the citizens of that country or make the situation worse. Arming any side in Syria is prolonging the conflict.
attributes.additional_details: It is time to do what we can to help Syrian citizens and stop our involvement.

attributes.action: Disallow M.P.s working for firms who have successfully lobbied them as ministers
attributes.background: M.P.s should not profit from their time in office, consorting with firms who lobby them. offering jobs after they leave office, for being compliant with their requests.
attributes.additional_details: Too many M.P.s from the last government and the previous one who held high office went on after losing their seats to take up posts with the very people who had been lobbying them for lucrative  contracts. The health service, television,the eco industry to name a few. M.P.s should be in office to serve the people not feather their nests for the future.

attributes.action: Do not build an extra runway at any London airport. Increase efficiency.
attributes.background: Rather than spending millions on building a new runway we need to better use what airports we have and increase the speed and efficiency of public transport. If we are to meet global CO2 reduction targets this is of paramount importance. Air travel needs not be idolised.
attributes.additional_details: CO2 concentrations are increasing and this is causing global temperatures to rise. Rather than focusing on increased capacity for air travel, encouraging it, we need to better use the airports we have and link them with better (and greener) public transport. This is of paramount importance if we are serious about anthropogenic climate change and considering the Paris agreement. Perhaps we could create jobs in tree-planting, conservation and green energy instead?

attributes.action: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 until 23rd June, 2031.
attributes.background: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union until 23rd June, 2031, that is a period of 15 years from the referendum date. This delay is to enable the economy to stabilise and allow proper preparations to be put in place for the separation from the European Union.

attributes.action: Demand that better aid be provided for countries in need of clean and safe water
attributes.background: This petition is in opposition to the decisions to divert funding from aid made leaders of international development from the UK. Help secure the well being and livelihoods for some the 650 million people (10 times the British population) worldwide who live without something as vital as safe water.
attributes.additional_details:
Many NGOs such as WaterAid fear that the approach to foreign aid made by current British Secretary of State for International Development, Priti Patel, will heavily damage the support that the world's poorest people desperately have to receive. It is imperative that this is corrected the current aid work can have long term, meaningful effect.

https://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/sep/14/uk-ngos-raise-concerns-about-priti-patels-new-approach-to-foreign-aid

attributes.action: A referendum to change our system of electing a representative
attributes.background: A call for a referendum to change our system of electing a representative with 3 options either keep our current system which is First past the post or change to either Alternative vote or the Single transferable vote to ensure a more representative Parliment/Democracy.

attributes.action: make abortion illegal in the uk unless raped or health risks to mum or baby
attributes.background: make abortion illegal in the united kingdom unless pregnant by rape or there is health risks to the mum and/or baby

attributes.action: Make all retail and commercial premises prominently display their street numbers
attributes.background: Most shops and commercial premises fail to display their street numbers at all, making it very difficult to find them by address. This adds to high street congestion, pollution and potential for accidents by distracted drivers. Prominently displaying their street number should be a legal requirement

attributes.action: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.
attributes.background: We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom. As well as how unfairly Scotland is treated buy the rest of the UK they seem to forget about all the English money that is used to help and support Scotland. So i propose we have a show of hands to see how many people in the rest of the UK would want to become separated from Scotland. I think that Scotland would be shocked at the result of this partition

attributes.action: Add an extra voting option to the next election of "Electoral Reform!"
attributes.background: Every year I vote for an less popular party as a type of "rebel" vote. This is the only way I feel heard. Now is the time to allow the public to express their concerns about the way OUR government is elected! Brexit has given us a new opportunity to concentrate on The UK! Let us be heard!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/

attributes.action: Fund the NHS by increasing income-tax by 2 pence in the pound.
attributes.background: The NHS is on its knees, it requires reorganisation which means a lot more funding than is currently available from the Government purses.  We ALL benefit from the NHS and we CANNOT allow it to fall 'unfit for purpose'. "Once it has gone - there will be no turning back"
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS should be free service to all UK citizens and that is true in most cases however, 'nothing is free in life'. If we want to be able to visit a doctor when we feel ill or go to Casualty, when our child or other loved one has suffered a serious injury or perhaps receive cancer treatment or other medical care - maybe we need to call an ambulance in an emergency, we need to keep and fund the NHS.

To keep this service the NHS has to be paid for!!!

Working people could pay 2 pence in the pound  & those of us receiving State benefits & pensions to have 2% deducted at source.

 I want my grandchildren to be able to have access to a good NHS but we must all do our bit to pay for. 

Please sign this petition to help us achieve it.

attributes.action: Have an annual referendum on the most signed petition to make it legally binding
attributes.background: In late 2006 the government set up the e-petitions website as a way for people to engage with politics. Millions of people have signed petitions, but we still don't feel like these petitions are given any real attention or importance. Petitions having the chance to become laws would change this.
attributes.additional_details:
The e-petitions website was created in November 2006 and the created petitions cover everything from tax to immigration, moral and ethical concerns, education, science and the very direction of the country. 

In 2015, the BBC reported "an unnamed government minister branded the site an own-goal thought up by a "prat"". 
People still don't feel the issues they are passionate about are taken seriously. We create and sign petitions because we want to see change, we want our voices to be heard.

attributes.action:
Debate WAVE POWER v Fracking & Nuclear -  all 3 are Constant 
Sources of power.
attributes.background:
Other "constants" Fracking and Nuclear are dangerous and dearer, tax
gets lost, profits go overseas, amnesia over decommissioning & waste.

attributes.action: Have one NHS distribution centre and buying in bulk whilst making cheaper deals.
attributes.background: We need to have one NHS distribution centre sending all the medical equipment and medicines to each individual hospital. Buying in bulk,getting better and more controled deals. Stoping different hospitals paying different prices,hopefully saving millions. The NHS deserves a better deal,and so do we!

attributes.action: Stop forcing English Standard on Young Deaf children
attributes.background: Make English more accessible for Deaf People (e.g. for us not to be forced to achieve English at C grade standard) each classes should have specialist tutor (e.g. Teacher of Deaf and being taught in small groups) Deaf people should not being stopped progressing from achieving a C grade or above
attributes.additional_details: English is our second language, as we find English so hard to understand! which is why we use Sign Language which has a different structure and no written language. We need to stop feeling like we are being forced to learn English at C grade Standard and it is important that we taught English in a way that is accessible to us.

attributes.action: Allow heating in education to be on in all colder months through more funding
attributes.background: I myself am a student of 16 with asthma. Throught my whole time in education I , along with all my peers , have suffered through the lack of heating. Simply wrapping up warm doesn't work, as breathing in cold air causes illnesses , leading to absents. Please help change this.

attributes.action: Provide Education Staff with Statutory guidance in the use of force in Schools.
attributes.background: In the UK there is no Statutory Guidance for the use of force for Education staff to ensure their Safety. The Guidance published by the Department of Education is non Statutory, this is placing education staff in dangerous situations as they are unsure what action they can take to protect themselves
attributes.additional_details: Under the Health and Safety act 2005 section 8, "Every employer shall ensure, so far as is reasonably practicable, the safety, health and welfare at work of his or her employees." It is officially recognised by the HSE that the Education sector is a occupation that comes into contact with violence in the workplace. They have published guidance in the measures to be taken to reduce this. DofE guidance is not statutory and this means staff are being put at risk as they are unsure what to do

attributes.action: Rebuild concorde as a bomber for RAF
attributes.background: We have no heavy bombers just jets and would be cheap as all ready have Airframe and Concorde is a great plane and supersonic .We can develope it to handle all bombs  .Great Britain needs to help the RAF get their heavy bomber
attributes.additional_details: Type RAF planes active duty your see no heavy bombers .We can not fight a large ground war without heavy bombers on our own if Europe falls

attributes.action: Change the funding for preschool so that all children start at age 3.
attributes.background: It is unfair that children who are born at the "wrong time"  miss out on schooling. Children who are born after term start dates have to wait till the next term to start school, meaning that a child who was born just before the term will benefit from funding while a child born after misses out.
attributes.additional_details: It should be that all children should get funding when they turn 3, regardless of term dates.

attributes.action: Introduce a plan of anti-ransomware measures
attributes.background: Ransomware computer viruses target more and more ordinary UK citizens and organizations. Viruses like described here: http://myspybot.com/odin-virus/ cause huge damages. Millions flow away into cyber criminals' pockets. We want to know what is being done to protect us.
attributes.additional_details:
Plenty of things an be done:

 - Government can strengthen cryptocurrencies related laws. For example, make Bitcoin exchange companies keep records of their users.   

- Government can cooperate with security professionals to develop decryption tools.

- Government can introduce stronger online data protection policies. Organizations should create backups of their data.

- Government can raise awareness that we should stop paying to hackers. Make paying immoral and maybe illegal.

attributes.action: Stop tax exiles from claiming government subsidies of any sort
attributes.background:
If anyone chooses to be a tax exile and not pay their fair share of tax to the British people then they should be excluded from the tax system completely, this  should include receiving any form of taxpayers money
If they wish to opt out of the system they should opt out completely

attributes.action: Repeal of the Vagrancy Act of 1824.
attributes.background: This act declares it a criminal act to sleep on the streets or to beg, hence making homelessness a crime.
attributes.additional_details:
The number of cases brought to court under the 1824 Vagrancy Act has surged by 70%, prompting concerns that cuts to support services and benefits are pushing more people to resort to begging. (2009)

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2014/nov/30/begging-prosecutions-increase-england-wales

attributes.action: Publish all registered sex offenders names, addresses and nature of crime.
attributes.background: America allows all law enforcement to publish to the public the names, addresses and crimes committed by all sex offenders.  we as the UK public should be able to have this information to keep our kids safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megan%27s_Law Link to background info on Megan's law this has been running successfully for many years and is proof that it works! The united kingdom public should be informed in order to protect our children if we don't know where they are how can we protect our vulnerable members of society.

attributes.action: Ban weapons using nanotechnology before they are able to be produced
attributes.background: Nanotechnology could be reality in the next few years and, while there are many benefits of this, the potential of nanotech weapons is too great a threat to humanity to be allowed, these weapons must be banned before they can be produced to prevent the devistation that could arise from their use

attributes.action: Decrease the required number of signatures for a debate by 10,000
attributes.background: With a gap of 90,000 signatures between an out-ruling response and a fair debate, there are becoming unacceptable amounts of valid opinions on law and rights shared by thousands upon thousands, which don't get a look in. Shredding this by a mere 10,000 is reasonable in context.

attributes.action: Vehicle tax (Road Fund Licence) per day, not month
attributes.background: Following the changes in vehicle tax, vehicle owners are now forced to surrender the value of the vehicle tax up until the end of the month in which they sell the vehicle.
attributes.additional_details:
Vehicle buyers are also forced to buy a full month, when they will not have had the use of the days preceeding the vehicle purchase.

It is also the case that the computer systems which coordinate the purchase of vehicle tax are given a concentrated workload at the end of each month. This has recently resulted in the service being unavailable.

I propose that vehicle tax should be available daily so that buyers and sellers are not short-changed, and that the systems are more able to cope with a more uniform demand.

This petition is of interest to anyone in the UK who will either buy or sell a motor vehicle.

Please rectify this unfair practice.

attributes.action: Increase Government powers over interest rates to protect savers.
attributes.background: Since 2008 the Bank of England has relentlessly cut interest rates causing savers to lose a considerable amount of income and this has now reached an unacceptable level.  At the moment, the Government has limited power over interest rates.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls for greater Government powers of the Bank of England's interest rates, so that savers can be protected.

attributes.action: Require proposed Great Reform Bill to give Parliament a veto on terms of BREXIT.
attributes.background: A repeal bill has been proposed to enable BREXIT, as of the date BREXIT takes effect. We propose this bill contain provisions for a Parliamentary vote or referendum approving the terms of BREXIT, and that for the purposes of the Act BREXIT shall not take effect until such approval has been given.
attributes.additional_details: We the people have the undisputed right, per the 2016 referendum to leave the EU. If the terms of leaving are unacceptable, it should neither be disputed that we have the right to change our minds. While it appears the Prime Minister intents to trigger article 50 without Parliamentary consent or knowledge of a likely deal, Parliament and the people can be given a say by the mechanism described above. The Act means the proposed Great Repeal Bill referred to by Mrs May in Conference on 02/10/2016.

attributes.action: All cyclists to have a basic third party insurance cover.
attributes.background: There are more and more people using bicycles these days and accidents happen. So what happens when a cyclist hits you or your vehicle and the blame is no them? Nothing because they are an uninsured vehicle, It's time for change.

attributes.action: To Exempt Final Year Uni students From Council Tax, For Their Entire Tenancy.
attributes.background: The government demand that final year Uni students pay council tax for the period between the conclusion of final term right up until the end of your tenancy. This is regardless of the length of your contract (often demanded by landlords to be 11 months) and the fact that you signed it as a student.
attributes.additional_details: My housemates and I feel we were not sufficiently warned or provided any clear statements to make us aware of this law and feel that either this approach must be changed, or that the demand for council tax over these outlying months, be removed completely. We want to help raise awareness for other students so that they don't get caught out too. As graduates we don't earn too much straight after University and to be suddenly hit with a bill that we were unaware of is quite stressful.

attributes.action: Request the Football Association to boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background: Russia's state-sponsored drugs abuse in sport, human rights contraventions, cyber hacking, actions in Ukraine and Syria, and total disdain for world opinion, demonstrates that it should not be rewarded by being allowed to host a World event.

attributes.action: raise issue of election with the Zimbabwean gov &/or the international community
attributes.background: Asking the UK government to help raise the issue about re election in Zimbabwe because there needs to be a strong change in order to reduce poverty, lower unemployment rates, pay civil servants and better the health care

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to sort out the funding for Bisphosphonates for breast cancer.
attributes.background: Thousands of women are potentially missing out on taking these inexpensive drugs because of the lack of national guidance on who should fund them. It is not clear whether the hospital trust, the local clinical commissioning group (CCG) or NHS England central funding should be paying for them.

attributes.action: Drones need unique reg number created by manufacturer which is assigned to buyer
attributes.background:
Problem is there is currently no way of matching a Drone with an owner.

Worse case was a Drone which collided with a British Airway flight over Heathrow. Story covered on 18th April, 2016 - Daily Telegraph
attributes.additional_details:
Daily Telegraph

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2016/04/18/drone-laws-in-the-uk--what-are-the-rules/

BBC

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-35442130

attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown's ban from entering the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Due to the incident involving Rihanna in 2009, Chris Brown was banned from entering the United Kingdom as a result of his 5 year probation. 

Chris Brown was relieved of his probation last year and has not had a major run in with the police since.

He has the right to be allowed in the Uk.
attributes.additional_details:
May 27th 2014 - His daughter was born. Chris Brown has proven to be a good role model since the birth of his daughter. 

Chris Brown suffers from Bipolar Disorder and PTSD

attributes.action: Pass legislation to abolish the payment of full council tax on probate property
attributes.background: It seems that councils are now charging 100% council tax on probate properties, irrespective of whether efforts are being made to sell or rent them. Legislation, it seems, will allow them to charge 150% or even 200% next year. This is immoral and unfair and nothing more than another unfair tax.

attributes.action: Stop employment agencies using incremental holiday pay as part of basic rate.
attributes.background: Recruitment agencies, particularly within the construction industry, agree a basic rate and then make that rate up of a lower basic rate up of a lower rate plus incremental holiday pay. This is common practice, but the law clearly states that holiday pay must be a "true addition" to the basic rate.

attributes.action: The government to help victims of domestic violence
attributes.background: social services need further training with dealing with women of domestic violence they are quick enough to take children away from women but they are not trained to support women in getting out of these relationship or helping women to be reunited with their children
attributes.additional_details: All cases involving social services and courts should have a expert witness available to explain to everyone the effects and complications of domestically violent relationships also to help everyone understand it. Too many women are just deemed as bad mothers for not being able to escape domestically abusive relationship when there is no support even from social services

attributes.action: Raise UK Legal Limit of Stakes For Poker In Pubs To £10 & £20 In Members Clubs
attributes.background:
The gambling act 2005 states: 
Low stakes poker is permitted in pubs, with stakes kept to a maximum of £5 per player, with a £100 max pot per premises per day. 
Low stakes poker in social clubs, with the correct permit, allows a maximum of £10 per player £250 total pot per premises per day
attributes.additional_details:
We're petitioning to change this law to the following:
Low stakes poker to be permitted in pubs with stakes kept to: £10 Maximum per player with no maximum pot, in social clubs: £20 maximum per player no maximum pot (modify the gaming permit licence)
stake limits should now be raised as inflation no longer reflects the outdated limits set in the gambling act 2005 & an unrestricted maximum pot size
We believe that this change to the law would also benefit all UK pubs who are struggling to survive
